com.unibeta.vrules.engines

Interface ValidationEngine


  • public interface ValidationEngine
    ValidationEngine interface. The validation engine service interface.
    Author:
    Jordan.Xue

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] validate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> objMap, java.lang.String vRulesFileName)
      Validates the objects in Map and return error messages if validates failed, the key of the map element can be the validation entityId configured in validation files.
      java.util.List validate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> objMap, java.lang.String vRulesFileName, java.lang.Object decisionObj)
      Validates the objects in Map, the key of the map element can be the validation entityId configured in validation files.
      java.lang.String[] validate(java.lang.Object[] objects, java.lang.String vRulesFileName)
      Validates a array of objects via the specified rules' file.The input parameter object can be whatever datatype.
      java.util.List validate(java.lang.Object[] objects, java.lang.String vRulesFileName, java.lang.Object decisionObj)
      Validates an array object via the specified rule's file, meanwhile registering the returned error object instance type.

      Validates the specified object via the validation rules.

      Validates an object via the specified rule's file, meanwhile registering the returned error object instance type.

      java.util.List validate(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String vRulesFileName, java.lang.String entityId, java.lang.Object decisionObj)
      Validates the specified object by entityId, meanwhile registering the returned error object .The parameter object can be whatever datatype.

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        java.lang.String[] validate(java.lang.Object object,
                          java.lang.String vRulesFileName)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Validates the specified object via the validation rules. The defaule id is the class name.The parameter object can be whatever datatype.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be validated
        vRulesFileName - the full path name of rule configuration located.
        Returns:
        null if validate passed, otherwise return error messages. *
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the input object is null.
        java.lang.Exception

        java.util.List validate(java.lang.Object[] objects,
                      java.lang.String vRulesFileName,
                      java.lang.Object decisionObj)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Validates an array object via the specified rule's file, meanwhile registering the returned error object instance type.
        Parameters:
        objects -
        vRulesFileName -
        decisionObj -
        Returns:
        the error object list, which is of decisionObj Class type, if validated failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • validate

        java.util.List validate(java.lang.Object object,
                      java.lang.String vRulesFileName,
                      java.lang.String entityId,
                      java.lang.Object decisionObj)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Validates the specified object by entityId, meanwhile registering the returned error object .The parameter object can be whatever datatype.
        Parameters:
        object -
        vRulesFileName - the full path name of rule configuration located.
        entityId -
        decisionObj -
        Returns:
        the error object list, which is of decisionObj Class type, if validated failed.
        Throws:
        Exception.
        java.lang.Exception

      • validate

        java.lang.String[] validate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> objMap,
                          java.lang.String vRulesFileName)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Validates the objects in Map and return error messages if validates failed, the key of the map element can be the validation entityId configured in validation files. It can be specially used for contexted object validation.
        NOTE: If the key of the map is not matched with any entityId configured in validation file, such element would be ignored.
        Parameters:
        objMap - Mapped objects.
        vRulesFileName - the full path name of rule configuration located.
        Returns:
        null if validate passed, otherwise return error messages.
        Throws:
        Exception.
        java.lang.Exception

      • validate

        java.util.List validate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> objMap,
                      java.lang.String vRulesFileName,
                      java.lang.Object decisionObj)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Validates the objects in Map, the key of the map element can be the validation entityId configured in validation files. It can be used for contexted object validation.
        NOTE: If the key of the map is not matched with any entityId configured in validation file, such element would be ignored.
        Parameters:
        objMap - Mapped objects
        vRulesFileName - the full path name of rule configuration located.
        decisionObj -
        Returns:
        null if validate passed, otherwise return error messages.
        Throws:
        Exception.
        java.lang.Exception
